page.title: 12HIGHAM FERRERS MANOR HOUSE
page.content:
The Manor House ,Higham Ferrers,was originally built as the rectory to the Church.
Chamberlin Phipps who have factories both localy and worldwide, bought the Manor House in 1954. They use it to show prospective buyers the plastic and adhesive products they make.
A group of pupils from the Ferrers School went along to see the Manor House. This is their report:
"From the outside we thought the Manor House looked small and quite plain. We were suprised on entering the House to see how large it actually is. Downstairs the rooms are filled with impressive antiques. The upstairs showroom is modern and spacious, only the creaking floorboards tell its age."
